oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Confederate soldiers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two of three the Teague brothers of Moscow, Tenn. in Fayette County are seated with cigars in their mouth. They wore either infantry or cavalry shell jackets and one wore a "pork pie" hat. The three brothers who served in the Civil War were: Pvt. Benjamin Franklin Teague, Co. E, 13th Tenn. Inf., CSA, Pvt. James Teague, Co. L, 2nd Partisan Rangers, Miss. Cav., CSA, and Pvt. Jeff Teague, Co. C, 20th Tenn. (Nixon's) Cav., CSA.
